level.text: A business enterprise shall be eligible for certification as a disadvantaged business enterprise if the business enterprise is:
Owned, operated, and controlled by economically disadvantaged individuals; and
Is a local business enterprise; or

A business enterprise that is affiliated with another business enterprise through common ownership, management, or control shall be eligible for certification as a disadvantaged business enterprise if:
The business enterprise seeking certification as a disadvantaged business enterprise is a local business enterprise;
In the event of a parent-subsidiary affiliation, both enterprises meet the requirements of subsection (a) of this section; and
The business enterprise has an average annualized gross receipts totaling $75 million or less.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-192 repealed subsec. (a)(2)(B); and, in subsec. (b)(1), deleted "or a qualified metropolitan area business enterprise" following "local business enterprise". Prior to repeal, subsec. (a)(2)(B) read as follows: "(B) Is a qualified metropolitan area business enterprise;"
D.C. Law 18-141, in subsec. (b), deleted "and" from the end of par. (1); substituted "; and" for a period at the end of par. (2), and added par. (3).
